intro: Euphrasia officinalis var. purpureocaerulea, commonly known as the purple-blue eyebright, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that range in color from purple to blue. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and meadows. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are clustered in whorls along the stems. Euphrasia officinalis var. purpureocaerulea has been traditionally used in herbal medicine for its purported soothing properties on the eyes and respiratory system.
